PSRI1.description: Select from the list of options.
PSRI1.title: Are the original data publicly available?

PSRI2.description: Select from the list of options.
PSRI2.title: Is the original code available?

PSRI3.description: Answer if the data are publicly available.
PSRI3.title: Where are the original data archived (name and url)?

PSRI4.description: Answer if the code is publicly available.
PSRI4.title: Where is the original code publicly archived (name and url)?

PSRI5.description: Select from the list of options.
PSRI5.title: Will you submit your replication code to this Dataverse (This is a PSRI requirement)?

PSRI6.description: Select from the list of options.
PSRI6.title: Will you submit your replication write-up to this Dataverse (This is a PSRI requirement)?

PSRI7.description: Select from the list of options.
PSRI7.title: Did you send the replication materials to the original author(s) and notify them that you'd be posting your replication on PSRI?

PSRI8.description: Select from the list of options.
PSRI8.title: Was the replication done in a course? (If so, please continue to answer the subsequent questions, and if not, select N/A)

PSRI9.description: Select from the list of options.
PSRI9.title: Did another student attempt to replicate the replication in the class?

PSRI10.description: Select from the list of options.
PSRI10.title: Did another student replicate this replication successfully?

PSRI11.description: Select from the list of options.
PSRI11.title: Did a professor read/review a draft before the final version?
